file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 53-21-07-04 - SERVICE DOOR GUIDES - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL SERVICE DOOR GUIDES - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the service door guides. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 53-21-07-000-801-A SERVICE DOOR GUIDES - REMOVAL SERVICE DOOR GUIDES - INSTALLA- ALL 53-21-07-400-801-A TION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 53-21-07 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 53-21-07-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. SERVICE DOOR GUIDES - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to remove the service door guides. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM SDS 52-43-00/1 C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 821 Service door D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Torque wrench To tighten the screws available E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Protective Gloves For protection of technicians hands 1 available Commercially Safety Goggles For protection of technicians eyes 1 available F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) ASTM-D-740 Methyl Ethyl Ketone - MEK AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task At the main door frames I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Put the aircraft on safe condition. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 53-21-07 Page 2 of 6 Rev 52 - Apr 28/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Open the service-door (AMM SDS 52-43-00/1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 53-21-07 Page 3 of 6 Rev 52 - Apr 28/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Service Door Guides - Removal/Installation Figure 401 B A C 1 SCREW (2) D 3 GUIDE D 1 DAMPER DET. D DET. A (TYP) 3 2 DRIFT PIN GUIDE 2 3 DRIFT PIN GUIDE DAMPER 2 SCREW (2) DAMPER GUIDE GUIDE DET. C DET. B 1 APPLY COR-BAN 27L TO THE SCREWS AND AT THE INTERFACE BETWEEN SCREW (2) 2 THE DOOR FRAME AND THE DAMPER. 2 APPLY COR-BAN 27L TO THE SCREWS AND AT THE INTERFACE BETWEEN THE DOOR FRAME AND THE DRIFT PIN GUIDE. 3 FOR AIRCRAFT POST-MOD SB145-53-0040 OR SB145-53-0088 APPLY ALODINE 1200S AND EPOXY PRIMER. EM145AMM530245D.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 53-21-07 Page 4 of 6 Rev 52 - Apr 28/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 53-21-07-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. SERVICE DOOR GUIDES - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to install the service door guides. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 20-10-01/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES SERVICE-DOOR ACTUATING AND LOCKING MECH- AMM TASK 52-43-06-700-801-A/500 ANISM - FUNCTIONAL CHECK CPM 51-21-03 - CPM 51-21-04 - IPC 53-21-00 CENTRAL I S.B.145-53-0040 - S.B.145-53-0088 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 821 Service door D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Torque wrench To tighten the screws available E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Protective Gloves For protection of technicians hands 1 available Commercially Safety Goggles For protection of technicians eyes 1 available F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MEP 09-075 Corrosion-Inhibiting Compound (COR-BAN 27L) AR MIL-C-5541 Alodine 1200S AR MEP 10-059 Epoxy Primer AR EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 53-21-07 Page 5 of 6 Rev 52 - Apr 28/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Central I IPC 53-21-00 AR H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task At the main door frames I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A NOTE: Make sure that the door frame area where the door guide is installed does not show signs of corrosion. If it does, contact the EMBRAER Technical Support Department. (1) For aircraft POST-MOD. S.B.145-53-0040 or S.B.145-53-0088, Perform a chemical conversion touch-up of all bare metal surface in the holes using (refer to CPM 51-21-04) and then apply Epoxy primer (refer to CPM 51-21-03). WARNING: COR-BAN 27L IS TOXIC TO SKIN, EYES, AND RESPIRATORY TRACT. USE PVC GLOVES AND EYE PROTECTION. USE ONLY IN WELL VENTILATED AREAS. OBEY THE MANUFACTURER’S HEALTH AND SAFETY INSTRUCTIONS. (2) Apply COR-BAN 27L at the interface between the door frame and the damper or drift pin guide, as applicable, at the guide position. (3) Install the service door guide with the screws soaked in COR-BAN 27L. NOTE: For torque, refer to (AMM MPP 20-10-01/200). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Do a functional check of the service door ( AMM TASK 52-43-06-700-801-A/500). (2) If necessary, adjust the actuating and locking mechanism of the service door ( AMM TASK 52-43-06-700-801-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 53-21-07 Page 6 of 6 Rev 52 - Apr 28/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
